item.title: Anomaly Detection
item.description: Point Anomaly Detection - Grubbs’ test Grubbs’ test1 is commonly used technique to detect an outlier in univariate problem, where normality assumption is required. It can be formualted as either one-side testing problem or two-sided testing problem. The hypothesis test is defined as \[H_0: \text{There are no outlier in the data set} \quad H_1: \text{There is exactly one outlier in the data set}.\] For two-sided testing, it tries to determine whether the observation with the largest absolute deviation is an outlier, where the test statistic is defined as
